userStories.title: Project Setup & Repository Structure
acceptanceCriteria: Monorepo structure created with `apps/web/`, `apps/api/`, `packages/shared/`, `packages/ui/`, `workflows/`, `docker/`, and `docs/` directories
Package.json/workspace configuration enables cross-package dependencies and shared code
TypeScript configured with strict mode enabled across all packages
ESLint and Prettier configured with shared rules and pre-commit hooks (Husky)

README.md includes setup instructions, architecture overview, and development guidelines

CI/CD pipeline configured (GitHub Actions or GitLab CI) with automated testing and Docker builds
userStories.notes: As a developer, I want a properly structured monorepo with frontend, backend, shared packages, and configuration, so that the codebase is organized, maintainable, and supports efficient development workflows.

userStories.title: Multi-Tenant Database Architecture
acceptanceCriteria: PostgreSQL 15+ database configured with connection pooling (PgBouncer)
Database migration system implemented (TypeORM, Prisma, or similar) with version control
Public schema created for system-wide tables (tenants, migrations, shared_data like countries, timezones)
Tenant schema creation function implemented that creates isolated schema per tenant on signup
All tenant-specific tables created in tenant schemas (users, content, workflows, social_accounts, analytics, etc.)
Database connection middleware automatically routes queries to correct tenant schema based on JWT token
Tenant schema deletion function implemented for complete data removal (GDPR compliance)
Database backup strategy configured with daily snapshots and point-in-time recovery capability
Read replica support configured for horizontal scaling of read operations
Migration rollback capability tested and documented
userStories.notes: As a system architect, I want a schema-per-tenant database architecture, so that tenant data is completely isolated and the system can scale to thousands of tenants.

userStories.title: User Authentication System
acceptanceCriteria: User registration endpoint accepts email, password, and optional tenant creation
Password hashing implemented using bcrypt with salt rounds (minimum 10)
Email verification flow implemented with verification tokens and expiration (24 hours)
Login endpoint validates credentials and returns JWT access token (15 min expiry) and refresh token (30 day expiry)
OAuth 2.0 integration implemented for Google, Microsoft, and Okta with proper scopes
OAuth callback handlers process authorization codes and create/update user accounts
JWT token generation includes user_id, tenant_id, role, and permissions
Refresh token endpoint validates refresh token and issues new access/refresh token pair
Token rotation implemented (refresh tokens are single-use, new pair issued on each refresh)
Logout endpoint invalidates refresh tokens and clears session
Password reset flow implemented with secure tokens, email delivery, and expiration (1 hour)
Rate limiting implemented for authentication endpoints (5 attempts per 15 minutes)
2FA (TOTP) support implemented as optional security enhancement
Session management tracks active sessions with device information and last activity
userStories.notes: As a user, I want to authenticate using email/password or OAuth providers, so that I can securely access the platform with my preferred authentication method.

userStories.title: Basic User Management

userStories.title: Health Check & System Status
acceptanceCriteria: `/health` endpoint returns 200 OK with basic status when system is operational

-- **Goal:** Implement OAuth 2.0 connections for all 8 social media platforms enabling users to connect their accounts and manage platform-specific settings. -- **Goal:** Build AI-powered content generation capabilities using ComfyUI integration, establish workflow marketplace foundation, and implement workflow execution with n8n orchestration. This epic enables users to generate videos and images using AI workflows, access pre-built workflows from marketplace, and create custom workflows for their specific needs.
userStories.notes: As a user, I want to view and manage all my connected platform accounts in one place, so that I can easily see connection status and manage my accounts.

userStories.title: Admin Dashboard Overview
acceptanceCriteria: Dashboard displays: uptime percentage, error rate, average response time, active users (30 days), concurrent users
User metrics: total users, users by tier, new signups (month), churn rate, trial-to-paid conversion
Revenue metrics: MRR, ARR, overage revenue, IP rotation revenue, marketplace revenue, growth rate
Usage metrics: videos generated, posts published, GPU utilization, storage used, API calls
Real-time updates: metrics refresh automatically or on manual refresh
Time range selector: view metrics for different time periods (today, week, month, quarter, year)
Metric cards: key numbers with percentage change vs previous period
Charts and graphs: visualize trends over time
Alert indicators: highlight issues requiring attention (high error rate, low uptime, etc.)
Quick actions: common admin tasks accessible from dashboard
Export functionality: download dashboard data as CSV or PDF
Customizable widgets: admin can customize dashboard layout
userStories.notes: As a system administrator, I want a dashboard showing system health and key metrics, so that I can monitor platform status at a glance.

userStories.title: User Management
acceptanceCriteria: User list: displays all users with search, filter, sort functionality
User details: view user profile, subscription, usage, activity, billing history
User actions: suspend/reactivate, change tier/limits, login as user (with permission), delete user
User search: search by email, name, tenant ID, tier
User filtering: filter by tier, status (active, suspended, trial), signup date
Bulk actions: suspend multiple users, change tier for multiple users, export user list
User activity log: view all user actions with timestamps
User support: access user's support tickets and communication history
User analytics: view user's usage trends, engagement, retention metrics
User export: download user data as CSV
User import: bulk import users from CSV (for enterprise onboarding)
User communication: send system messages to users
userStories.notes: As a system administrator, I want to manage all users, so that I can provide support and maintain platform quality.

userStories.title: Workflow Curation
acceptanceCriteria: Scraped workflows queue: displays all workflows from automated scraping awaiting review
Workflow status: pending, reviewing, approved, rejected, duplicate
Workflow review interface: view workflow JSON, metadata, example outputs, source
Admin actions: approve, reject, mark as featured, mark as premium, assign category/tags
Bulk actions: approve/reject multiple workflows, assign category/tags in bulk
Quality control: test workflow before approval, generate sample outputs
Workflow editing: admin can edit workflow metadata, description, tags
Duplicate detection: identifies duplicate workflows and suggests merging
Workflow analytics: view workflow performance (downloads, ratings, usage)
Workflow moderation: remove inappropriate workflows, handle user reports
Workflow promotion: feature workflows on homepage, editor's choice badges
Workflow export: export workflow list and metadata
userStories.notes: As a system administrator, I want to curate workflows from automated scraping, so that the marketplace has high-quality, relevant workflows.

userStories.title: Platform Management
acceptanceCriteria: Platform status dashboard: shows health status for all 8 platforms
API key management: configure API keys for all platforms with rotation capability
Quota monitoring: track API quota usage per platform with alerts at 80%
Rate limit tracking: monitor rate limit usage and violations
Platform enable/disable: temporarily disable platforms for maintenance
Platform health checks: automated tests verify API connectivity and functionality
Error monitoring: track API errors and failures with alerting
Platform usage stats: view usage statistics per platform
Platform configuration: configure platform-specific settings and limits
Platform testing: test platform connections and publishing functionality
Platform documentation: maintain platform-specific documentation and requirements
Platform updates: track platform API changes and deprecations
userStories.notes: As a system administrator, I want to manage platform integrations, so that I can ensure all platform APIs are functioning correctly.

userStories.title: System Configuration
acceptanceCriteria: General settings: enable/disable platform features, configure tier limits and pricing
Email settings: configure email templates, SMTP settings, email delivery
Notification settings: configure notification preferences and delivery methods
Maintenance mode: enable maintenance mode with custom message
Security settings: encryption settings, audit log retention, session timeout, 2FA enforcement, IP whitelist/blacklist
Feature flags: enable/disable features for testing or gradual rollout
System limits: configure global limits (max file size, max workflow nodes, etc.)
Integration settings: configure external service integrations (Stripe, SendGrid, etc.)
Backup settings: configure backup frequency, retention, and restoration
Monitoring settings: configure alerting thresholds and notification channels
System logs: view system logs with filtering and search
Configuration export: export system configuration for backup
userStories.notes: As a system administrator, I want to configure system-wide settings, so that I can customize platform behavior and features.
